description: TO REFER S. 787 TO THE COMMITTEE ON PATENTS, ON A BILL TO PROTECT INNOCENT PURCHASERS OF PATENTED ARTICLES.
TO PROCEED TO CONSIDER S. 371, A BILL TO AID IN THE ESTABLISHMENT AND TEMPORARY SUPPORT OF THE COMMON SCHOOLS.
TO AGREE TO THE HOUSE RESOLUTION, THAT WHEN THE SENATE AND THE HOUSE ADJOURN ON THURSDAY DECEMBER 27, 1887, THEY STAND ADJOURNED UNTIL JANUARY 4, 1888.
TO PROVIDE THAT WHEN THE SENATE ADJOURNS TODAY IT DO SO UNTIL MONDAY.

TO AMEND S. 139, A BILL TO CREDIT AND PAY TO THE SEVERAL STATES, TERRITORIES AND THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA ALL MONIES COLLECTED UNDER THE DIRECT TAX LEVIED BY ACT OF CONGRESS, AUGUST 5, 1861, BY PROVIDING THAT ANY SUMS CREDITED TO ANY STATE, TERRITORY OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA THAT HAVE BEEN COLLECTED BE PAID TO THE GOVERNORS OF SAID STATES AND THAT NO PART OF SUCH MONEY APPROPRIATED BE WITHHELD BY THE U.S. TREASURY BECAUSE OF ANY INDEBTEDNESS BY ANY STATE, TERRITORY OR THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.

TO PASS A RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT THE COMMITTEE ON JUDICIARY BE INSTRUCTED TO INQUIRE INTO THE SUPPRESSION OF THE VOTES OF THE COLORED CITIZENS OF JACKSON, MISSISSIPPI, AT RECENT MUNICIPAL ELECTIONS, AND INTO THE ALLEGED PARTICIPATION IN SUCH SUPPRESSION BY THE U.S. DISTRICT ATTORNEY, AND BY A DEPUTY COLLECTOR OF INTERNAL REVENUE AND A DEPUTY UNITED STATES MARSHAL, AND TO REPORT FACTS TO SENATE.
TO PROCEED TO THE CONSIDERATION OF EXECUTIVE BUSINESS, AND TEMPORARILY LAY ASIDE CONSIDERATION OF S. 139.
TO PROCEED TO CONSIDERATION OF EXECUTIVE BUSINESS.
TO PASS A RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT LUCIUS Q. LAMAN BE APPOINTED ASSOCIATE JUSTICE OF THE SUPREME COURT.

TO AMEND S. 139, BY AUTHORIZING THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY, TO PAY EACH STATE A SUM EQUAL TO THE TAX COLLECTED THEREIN ON RAW COTTON, SAID SUMS TO BE HELD BY THE STATES, FIRST, FOR SUCH PRODUCERS WHO PAID THE TAX OR THEIR LEGAL REPRESENTATIVES, AS MAY MAKE CLAIM TO AND PROVE THEIR INDENTITY, AND REMAINDER, IF ANY, TO BE HELD AS A PERMANENT SCHOOL FUND; PROVIDED THAT WHEN COTTON IS PRODUCED IN ONE STATE AND SHIPPED TO ANOTHER, THE TAXES COLLECTED THEREON SHALL BE PAID TO THE STATES IN WHICH THE COTTON WAS PRODUCED, AND SUCH SUMS AS ARE NECESSARY TO ENFORCE THIS ACT SHALL BE APPROPRIATED OUT OF THE TREASURY.

TO AMEND S. 139 BY ELIMINATING A PROVISO BEGINNING IN LINE EIGHT, SECTION THREE, AND INSERTING INSTEAD; "ALL MONIES ASSESSED AND COLLECTED AS PART OF THE DIRECT TAX BY THE U.S. SHALL BE REFUNDED TO THE INDIVIDUALS OR THEIR LEGAL REPRESENTATIVES WHO BRING SUIT IN THE COURT OF CLAIMS THEREFOR."
TO PASS S. 139.

TO AMEND A TREATY BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE KINGDOM OF THE NETHERLANDS FOR THE EXTRADITION OF CRIMINALS, SIGNED JUNE 2, 1887, BY ELIMINATING 15TH CLAUSE, THEREBY EXCLUDING THE CHARGE OF LARCENY, DEFINED TO BE "THEFT OF EFFECTS, PERSONAL PROPERTY OR MONEY" AS BEING A CHARGE BY WHICH A CRIMINAL CAN BE EXTRADITED.
TO PROVIDE THAT WHEN THE SENATE ADJOURNS TODAY IT DO SO UNTIL MONDAY NEXT, JANUARY 23, 1888.

TO AMEND A RESOLUTION REGARDING APPOINTMENT OF A SELECT COMMITTEE FOR THE CONSIDERATION OF PRESIDENT'S MESSAGE IN REFERENCE TO PACIFIC RAILROAD, BY REFERRING THE MESSAGE AND REPORT TO A SPECIAL COMMITTEE OF SEVEN SENATORS INSTEAD OF FIVE.

TO AMEND H. R. 4271, A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR DEFICIENCIES FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1887, BY ELIMINATING THE CLAUSE FIXING THE RATE OF INTEREST DUE ON PENDING CLAIMS, ON SUCH AS HAVE ALREADY ACCURED, FOR EXCESS DUTIES COLLECTED, TOGETHER WITH COSTS OF SUITS AT THE RATE OF THREE PER CENT, AS IT WOULD EXTRACT MONEY FROM THE RIGHTFUL AND ACCURED CLAIMS OF CREDITORS, WHICH SHOULD BE ENTITLED TO A HIGHER RATE OF INTEREST.
TO PASS S. 257, A BILL TO PAY MARY S. LOGAN, WIDOW OF JOHN A. LOGAN, MAJOR GENERAL OF U.S. VOLUNTEERS IN THE WAR FOR THE UNION, A PENSION OF $2,000 ANNUALLY DURING HER NATURAL LIFE.

TO PASS S. 574, A BILL INCREASING THE PENSION OF MRS. APPOLINE A. BLAIR, WIDOW OF FRANCIS P. BLAIR, JR., MAJOR GENERAL OF U.S. VOLUNTEER IN THE WAR FOR THE UNION, $30 A MONTH, PUTTING HER ON THE SAME BASIS AS THE WIDOW OF GENERAL LOGAN, WHO WAS GRANTED A PENSION OF $2,000, ANNUALLY DURING HER NATURAL LIFE.
TO PROVIDE THAT WHEN THE SENATE ADJOURNS TODAY IT DO SO UNTIL MONDAY NEXT, JANUARY 30.
TO CONSIDER A TREATY BETWEEN THE U.S. AND GREAT BRITAIN CONCERNING EXTRADITION OF CRIMINALS, SIGNED AT LONDON, JUNE 25, 1886.
TO ADJOURN, WHILE CONSIDERING CERTAIN NOMINATIONS.
TO PROVIDE THAT WHEN SENATE ADJOURNS TODAY IT DO SO TO MEET ON MONDAY NEXT, FEBRUARY 6.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL THE FIRST MONDAY IN DECEMBER THE CONSIDERATION OF A TREATY BETWEEN THE U.S. AND BRITAIN CONCERNING THE EXTRADITION OF PRISONERS CHARGED WITH CRIME SIGNED AT LONDON JUNE 25, 1886.
TO PROCEED TO CONSIDERATION OF EXECUTIVE BUSINESS, THUS LAYING ASIDE THE S. 371, A BILL, TO AID IN THE ESTABLISHMENT AND TEMPORARY SUPPORT OF THE COMMON SCHOOLS.

TO AMEND S. 371, BY ELIMINATING SEC. 2 AND INSERTING THAT SUCH MONEY BE DIVIDED ANNUALLY AMONG THE STATES, TERRITORIES AND THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, ACCORDING TO THE POPULATION, RESPECTIVELY, BETWEEN THE AGES OF TEN AND 21 YEARS, BY THE 1880 CENSUS.
TO AMEND, S. 371, BY STRIKING OUT THAT SECTION OF THE BILL WHICH REQUIRES A REPORT FROM THE GOVERNOR OF A STATE OR TERRITORY, GIVING DETAILS OF THEIR SCHOOL SYSTEM.

TO AMEND S. 371, BY ELIMINATING THAT SECTION OF THE BILL WHICH REQUIRES A STATEMENT FROM THE GOVERNOR OF ANY STATE OR TERRITORY REGARDING THE DISBURSEMENTS OF SCHOOL FUNDS BEFORE THEY COULD RECEIVE A SECOND OR SUBSEQUENT ALLOTMENT.
TO PASS S. 371.
TO PROCEED TO THE CONSIDERATION OF S. 931, INCORPORATING THE WASHINGTON CABLE ELECTRIC RAILWAY OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.

TO AMEND S. 931, BY ELIMINATING THE CLAUSE "ALONG NEW YORK AVENUE TO 14TH STREET," AND IN LINE 38 AFTER THE WORK "ALONG" TO STRIKE OUT "FOURTEENTH" AND INSERT "FIFTEENTH," SO AS TO READ "ALONG FIFTEENTH STREET TO G STREET," THEREBY CHANGING THE ROUTE.
TO AMEND S. 931, BY PROVIDING THAT THE RAILS USED BY THE COMPANY BE OF AMERICAN MANUFACTURE.
TO AMEND S. 931, BY PROVIDING THAT THE COMPANY SHALL PAY TO THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA AS TAXES TEN PER CENT OF ITS GROSS EARNINGS PER YEAR.
TO AMEND S. 931, BY PROVIDING THAT THE COMPANY SHALL PAY TO THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA AS TAXES FOR EACH YEAR TEN PER CENT OF THE GROSS EARNINGS OF THE PRECEDING YR., NO QUORUM VOTING.
TO AMEND S. 931, BY CHANGING THE ROUTE OF THE COMPANY. NO QUORUM VOTING.
TO AMEND S. 931, BY CHANGING THE ROUTE OF THE COMPANY.
TO RECOMMIT S. 931.

TO AMEND S. 931, BY STRIKING OUT IN SECTION ONE LINES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, SIX AND SEVEN TO THE WORD "BE" IN THE SEVENTH LINE, AND TO INSERT IN LIEN THEREOF, "THAT SUCH PERSONS, NOT EXCEEDING 13 IN NUMBER, UNDER RULES AND REGULATIONS TO BE PRESCRIBED BY THE COMMISSIONERS OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA AND THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR, BE THE HIGHEST AND BEST BIDDERS FOR THE PRIVILEGES AND FRANCHISE HEREINAFTER GRANTED; NO QUORUM VOTING.

TO AMEND S. 931 BY STRIKING OUT IN SECTION ONE LINES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, SIX AND SEVEN TO THE WORD "BE" IN THE SEVENTH LINE AND TO INSERT IN LIEN THEREOF, "THAT SUCH PERSONS, NOT EXCEEDING 13 IN NUMBER, UNDER RULES AND REGULATIONS TO BE PRESCRIBED BY THE COMMISSIONERS OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA AND THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR, BE THE HIGHEST AND BEST BIDDERS FOR THE PRIVILEGES AND FRANCHISE HEREINAFTER GRANTED.
TO AMEND S. 931, BY PROVIDING THAT THE COMPANY SHALL REPORT TO THE COMMISSION OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA ALL DETAILS REGARDING ITS BUSINESS, SUCH AS STOCKHOLDERS, INCOME, ETC; NO QUORUM VOTING.
TO AMEND S. 931, BY PROVIDING THAT THE COMPANY SHALL REPORT TO THE COMMISSION OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA ALL DETAILS REGARDING ITS BUSINESS, SUCH AS STOCKHOLDERS, INCOME, ETC.

TO AMEND S. 931, BY PROVIDING THAT THE COMPANY SHALL PAY IN TAXES FOUR PER CENT OF THEIR GROSS RECEIPTS OF THE PRECEDING YEAR FOR FOUR YEARS; FOR THE NEXT FOUR YEARS SIX PER CENT AND THEREAFTER EIGHT PER CENT PER ANNUM.

TO AMEND S. 1305, (25 STAT L. 673), A BILL TO INCORPORATE THE MARITIME CANAL COMPANY OF NICARAGUA, BY ADDING, AS SECTION FIVE, A PROVISION TO PREVENT THE U.S. FROM BEING INVOLVED IN ANY MANNER IN ANY PECUNIARY OBLIGATIONS, EXCEPT THE PAYMENT OF TOLLS PROVIDED IN THIS ACT.

TO AMEND S. 1305, BY PROVIDING THAT NO PART OF THE CAPITAL STOCKS PAID IN SHALL BE, AT ANY TIME, WITHDRAWN OR RETURNED TO THE STOCKHOLDERS OR IN ANY MANNER DIVERTED FROM THE PROP- ER USES OF THE CORP. UNLESS FOR THE PURPOSE OF WITHDRAWING FROM OR WINDING UP ITS BUSINESS, AND THAT ANY PERSON VIOLATING THIS PROVISION SHALL BE PUNISHED BY A FINE NOT EXCEEDING $10,000 OR IMPRISONMENT FOR A PERIOD NOT EXCEEDING FIVE YEARS, OR BOTH, AT THE DESCRETION OF THE COURT.

TO AMEND S. 1305, BY INSERTING AT THE END OF SECTION THREE, A CLAUSE STATING THAT IF STOCK TO THE AMOUNT OF $10,000,000 SHALL NOT BE SUBSCRIBED AND TEN PER CENT THEREOF ACTUALLY PAID IN BEFORE THE EXPIRATION OF TWO YEARS FROM THE PASSAGE OF THIS ACT, OR IF THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE CANAL HAS NOT ACTUALLY COMMENCED, THEN THE FRANCHISE SHALL BE DEEMED TO CEASED.
TO AMEND S. 1305 BY PROVIDING THAT ALL LABORERS EMPLOYED IN SUCH WORK SHALL EITHER BE NATIVE OR NATURALIZED CITIZENS OF THE U.S.
TO AMEND S. 1305, BY STIPULATING THAT THE U.S. SHALL NOT BECOME INVOLVED IN ANY MANNER IN ANY OBLIGATIONS EXCEPT IN THE PAYMENT OF TOLLS PROVIDED IN THIS ACT.
TO PASS S. 1305.

TO AMEND S. 181, A BILL GRANTING PENSIONS TO EX-SOLDIERS AND SAILORS WHO ARE INCAPACITATED FOR THE PERFORMANCE OF MANUAL LABOR, AND PROVIDING FOR PENSIONS TO DEPENDENT RELATIVES OF DECEASED SOLDIERS AND SAILORS, BY INSERTING A PROVISO GRANTING PENSIONS TO DEPENDENT RELATIVES OF DECEASED SOLDIERS AND SAILORS WHO ARE WITHOUT ADEQUATE MEANS OF SUPPORT.
TO AMEND S. 181, BY PROVIDING THAT A PENSION OF $12 PER MONTH BE GIVEN TO PERSONS SERVING THREE MONTHS OR MORE, AND WHO WERE INCAPACITATED THROUGH PARTICIPATION IN SAID WAR.

TO AMEND S. 181, BY PROVIDING THAT SUCH PENSIONS SHALL COMMENCE FROM THE DATE OF THE FILING OF THE APPLICATION IN THE PENSION OFFICE, AFTER PASSAGE OF THIS ACT AND UPON PROOF THAT THE DISABILITY THEN EXISTED AND SHALL CONTINUE DURING THE EXISTENCE OF THE PENSIONER.

TO AMEND H. R. 6437, A BILL PROVIDING FOR CERTAIN OF THE MOST URGENT DEFICIENCIES IN THE APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE SERVICE OF THE GOVERNMENT FOR FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1888, BY ELIMINATING THE CLAUSE IN SECTION ONE, "THAT THE PUBLIC PRINTER IS HEREBY DIRECTED TO RIGIDLY ENFORCE THE PROVISIONS OF THE EIGHT HOUR LAW IN THE DEPARTMENT UNDER HIS CHARGE."
TO AMEND H. R. 6437, BY APPROPRIATING THE SUM OF $60,000 FOR THE PAY OF ASSISTANT CUSTODIANS AND JANITORS OF THE U.S. PUBLIC BUILDINGS FOR THE FIISCAL YEAR.
STO AMEND H. R. 6437, BY STIPULATING THAT THE SUM OF $60,000 BE APPROPRIATED FOR THE PAY OF ASSISTANT CUSTODIANS AND JANITORS OF U.S. PUBLIC BUILDINGS FOR THE CURRENT FISCAL YEAR.
TO PROVIDE THAT WHEN THE SENATE ADJOURNS TODAY IT DO SO UNTIL MONDAY.
TO AMEND S. 181, BY INSERTING A CLAUSE TO INCLUDE THE PAYMENT OF $12 PER MONTH PENSION TO THOSE EX-SOLDIERS AND SAILORS SUFFERING FROM INFIRMITIES DUE TO OLD AGE.
TO AMEND S. 181, BY INCLUDING ON THE PENSION LIST AT $12 PER MONTH ALL PERSONS WHO SERVED THREE MONTHS OR MORE IN THE WAR WITH MEXICO, OR THIRTY DAYS IN ANY OF THE WARS WITH INDIAN TRIBES.

TO AMEND S. 181, BY MAKING THOSE PERSONS ELIGIBLE FOR PENSIONS WHO HAVE BEEN HONORABLY DISCHARGED FROM THE U.S. ARMY WHO ARE NOW OR MAY HEREAFTER SUFFER FROM MENTAL OR PHYSICAL DISABILITIES, NOT THE RESULT OF THEIR OWN HABITS, WHICH INCAPACITATED THEM FROM THE PERFORMANCE OF MANUAL LABOR.
TO PASS S. 181.

TO AMEND A RESOLUTION, CALLING FOR THE APPOINTMENT OF A SELECT COMMITTEE OF SEVEN SENATORS TO EXAMINE INTO THE PRESENT CONDITION OF THE CIVIL SERVICE BY INCLUDING THE WRITTEN MESSAGES OF THE PRESIDENT AND POSTMASTER GENERAL AS THEY RELATE TO  PROHIBITING GOVERNMENTAL EMPLOYEES FROM BEING ASSOCIATED OR AFFILIATED WITH ANY POLITICAL PARTY IN AN OFFICAL SENSE.

TO AMEND S. 977, A BILL REGULATING THE IMPORTATION OF FOREIGN MERCHANDISE AND TO SECURE UNIFORMITY IN THE CLASSIFICATION AND VALUATION THEREOF, BY DECLARING THE FINDINGS OF THE BOARD OF APPRAISERS NOT CONCLUSIVE, BUT SUBJECT TO JUDICIAL REVIEW.

TO PASS S. 406, A BILL APPROPRIATING THE SUM OF $100,000 FOR THE ERECTION OF A MONUMENT IN THE GOVERNMENT RESERVATION BETWEEN HOWARD UNIVERSITY AND THE FREEDMEN'S HOSPITAL, IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, TO THE NEGRO SOLDIERS WHO GAVE THEIR LIVES FOR THE PRESERVATION OF THE UNION.
TO CONSIDER S. 1226, A BILL RELATING TO JOHN N. QUACKENBUSH, CONCERNING THE GRADE OF COMMANDER IN THE NAVY, AND TO CORRECT AN ERROR IN RELATION TO AN APPOINTMENT THEREIN.
TO PASS S. 1226, A BILL RELATING TO JOHN N. QUACKENBUSH, CONCERNING THE GRADE OF COMMANDER IN THE NAVY AND TO CORRECT AN ERROR IN RELATION TO AN AAPPOINTMENT THEREIN.

TO TABLE AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 5034, A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE PURCHASE OF U.S. BONDS BY THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY. THE AMENDMENT AUTHORIZES THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY TO ISSUE TREASURY NOTES IN EQUIVALENT AMOUNT TO ANY NATIONAL BANK'S SURRENDERED CIRCULATION, PROVIDED NO OTHER NATIONAL BANK TAKES THEM UP WITHIN 30 DAYS, SAID ISSUED TREASURY NOTES TO BE KEPT IN THE TREASURY UNTIL PAID OUT FOR GOVERNMENT DEBTS.

TO TABLE THE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 5034, WHICH PROVIDES THAT THE TREASURY NOTES TO BE ISSUED ARE RECEIVABLE FOR GOVERNMENT DUES AND LGAL TENDER ONLY BETWEEN NATIONAL BANKS; AND MAINTAINS THE PRESENT VOLUME OF PAPER MONEY OUTSTANDING, EXCLUSIVE OF GOLD OR SILVER CERTIFICATES.
TO AMEND H. R. 5034, BY STIPULATING THAT THE VOLUME OF PAPER MONEY OUTSTANDING (EXCLUSIVE OF GOLD AND SILVER CERTIFICATES) SHALL REMAIN AS NOW EXISTING.
TO PASS S. 71, A BILL RELATING TO THE CLAIM OF REAR ADMIRAL SAMUEL P. CARTER OF THE U.S. NAVY FOR PAY AND COMPENSATION OF A REAR ADMIRAL ON THE RETIRED LIST.

TO AMEND H. R. 2927, A BILL AUTHORIZING THE CONSTRUCTION OF A BRIDGE ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER AT MEMPHIS, TENNESEE, BY INCREASING THE MAIN CHANNEL SPAN FROM 700 FEET TO NO LESS THAN 1000 FEET IN LENGTH, SO AS NOT TO BE AN OBSTRUCTION TO RIVER TRAFFIC.

TO AMEND H. R. 2927, A BILL AUTHORIZING THE CONSTRUCTION OF A BRIDGE ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER AT MEMPHIS, TENNESEE, BY STIPULATING THAT SAID BRIDGE SHOULD PROVIDE FOR THE PASSAGE OF RAILWAY TRAINS, WAGONS AND VEHICLES OF ALL KINDS AND FOR FOOT PASSENGERS AND TRANSIT OF ANIMALS AT TOLL RATES APPROVED BY THE SECRETARY OF WAR.

TO REFER A RESOLUTION TO COMMITTEE ON FOREIGN RELATIONS, PROVIDING THAT AS MUCH OF RULES 36-38 AS PROVIDE FOR EXECUTIVE SESSIONS, BE SUSPENDED DURING CONSIDERATION OF THE FISHERIES TREATY, WHEN THE SAME SHALL BE REPORTED BY THE SENATE.
TO PROCEED TO CONSIDERATION OF S. 325, A BILL GRANTING RIGHT OF WAY THROUGH THE CROW INDIAN RESERVATION TO THE BILLINGS', CLARK'S FORK AND COOKE CITY RAILROAD COMPANY.
TO PASS S. 325, A BILL GRANTING RIGHT OF WAY THROUGH THE CROW INDIAN RESERVATION TO THE BILLINGS, CLARK'S FORK AND COOKE CITY RAILROAD.

TO AMEND H. R. 5034, BY AUTHORIZING THE SECRETARY OF TREASURY TO PURCHASE SILVER BULLION, IN ADDITION TO THE $2,000,000 PER MONTH MINIMUM FOR COINAGE PURPOSES, IN EQUAL AMOUNT TO THE CIRCULATION SURRENDERED BY NATIONAL BANKS NOT IN LIQUIDATION, PROVIDED THAT IT IS NOT TAKEN UP WITHIN 30 DAYS BY OTHER NATIONAL BANKS; THIS EXTRA SILVER BULLION, PURCHASES AT MARKET PRICE, SHALL BE COINED AND USED AS PROVIDED BY "AN ACT TO AUTHORIZE THE COINAGE OF THE STANDARD SILVER DOLLAR AND  RRESTORE ITS LEGAS TENDER CHARACTER," WHICH ACT IS KEPT INTACT.
TO RECOMMIT H. R. 5034.

TO AMEND H. R. 3839, A BILL GRANTING A PENSION TO MRS. HETTIE K. PAINTER, A VOLUNTEER NURSE DURING LATEWAR, BY AUTHORIZING THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR TO INCREASE HER PENSION FROM $12 TO $25 PER MONTH, SUBJECT TO PROVISIONS AND LIMITATIONS OF THE PENSION LAW.

TO AMEND S. 2083, A BILL ESTABLISHING A BUREAU OF ANIMAL INDUSTRY FOR THE PURPOSE OF FACILITATING EXPORTATION OF LIVESTOCK, AND TO ELIMINATE CERTAIN DISEASES, BY PROVIDING FOR THE ELIMINATION OF DISEASE AS WELL AS DISEASE CONDITIONS.

TO AMEND S. 1176, A BILL AUTHORIZING THE SALE TO ALIENS OF CERTAIN MINERAL LANDS, BY ALLOWING INDIVIDUAL ALIENS TO ACQUIRE MINING RIGHTS AND INTERESTS IN THE TERRITORIES, AND ENABLING THEM TO JOIN A PARTNERSHIP OF AMERICAN CITIZENS BUT REQUIRING THAT A MAJORITY OF SUCH PARTNERS BE CITIZENS AND EXCLUDING ANY FOREIGN CORPORATION FROM PURCHASING MINING RIGHTS TO AN UNLIMITED EXTENT; NO QUORUM VOTING.

TO AMEND S. 1176, BY FOLLOWING INDIVIDUAL ALIENS TO ACQUIRE MINING RIGHTS AND INTEREST IN THE TERRITORIES AND ENABLING THEM TO JOIN A PARTNERSHIP OF AMERICAN CITIZENS BUT REQUIRING THAT A MAJORITY OF SUCH PARTNERS BE CITIZENS AND EXCLUDING ANY FOREIGN CORPORATION FROM PURCHASING MINING RIGHTS TO AN UNLIMITED EXTENT.
TO PASS S. 1176.
TO PASS A RESOLUTION PROVIDING FOR THE APPOINTMENT OF JARED LAWRENCE RATHBOUR AS CONSUL GENERAL AT PARIS.

TO PROVIDE THAT WHEN THE SENATE ADJOURNS TODAY IT DO SO UN- TIL MONDAY, MADE DURING DEBATE ON S. 185, (25 STAT L. 676), A BILL PROVIDING FOR  THE ADMISSION OF THE STATE OF DAKOTA INTO THE UNION AND FOR THE ORGANIZATION OF THE TERRITORY OF LINCOLN.

TO MEND AN AMENDMENT TO S. 185, (IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE ENTIRE BILL) BY ELIMINATING THAT PART OF THE SUBSTITUTE BILL WHICH DECLARES SOUTH DAKOTA TO BE A STATE ADMITTED TO THE UNION, AND INSERTING INSTEAD A PROVISION THAT THE PEOPLE OF THE ENTIRE TERRITORY OF DAKOTA MEET IN A CONVENTION, PREPARE A CONSTITUTION, ORGANIZE A STATE GOVERNMENT, AND SUBMIT TO CONGRESS AND UPON APPROVAL BE ADMITTED INTO THE UNION AS ONE STATE.
TO PASS S. 185.

TO AMEND S. 1430, A BILL TO FORFEIT CERTAIN LANDS HERETOFORE GRANTED FOR TTHE PURPOSE OF AIDING IN THE CONSTRUCTION OF RAILROADS, BY ADDING A PROVISION THAT NOTHING IN THIS ACT SHALL LIMIT THE RIGHTS GRANTED TO PURCHASERS BY AN ACT APPROVED MARCH 3, 1887, NOR BE REGARDED AS REPEALING, ALTERING OR AMENDING SAID ACT, NOR AS AFFECTING ANY RIGHT OF A PURCHASER UNDER SAID ACT.

TO AMEND S. 554, A BILL AMENDING TITLE 60, CHAPTER THREE, OF THE REVISED STATUTES OF THE U.S., BY ELIMINATING THE SECTION WHICH PROHIBITS IMPORTATION OF ANY BOOKS OR COPYRIGHTED ARTICLES SO AS TO CONTINUE THE IMPORTATION OF THESE BOOKS ON PAYING THE PRESCRIBED DUTY; NO QUORUM VOTING.

TO AMEND S. 1430, A BILL TO FORFEIT CERTAIN LANDS HERETOFORE GRANTED FOR  THE PURPOSE OF AIDING IN THE CONSTRUCTION OF RAILROADS, BY ELIMINATING THE ONTONAGON AND BRULE RIVER RAILROAD COMPANY FROM BEING ENTITLED TO ANY GRANT UNDER THE ACT, THEREBY SHOWING PREFERENCE TO THE PORTAGE LAKE CANAL COMPANY.
TO TABLE AN AMENDMENT TO S. 1430, DEALING WITH CERTAIN CASES IN WHICH LAND WAS FORFEITED TO THE U.S. FROM RAILROAD GRANTS MADE TO THE STATE OF MICH.; NO QUORUM VOTING.

TO TABLE THE AMENDMENT TO S. 1430, WHICH PROVIDES NOT TO CONFIRM ANY PRIVATE ENTRY FOR LAND HERETOFORE SETTLED UPON AND NOW CLAIMED UNDER COLOR OF THE HOMESTEAD ON PRE-EMPTION LAWS, BUT CLAIMS OF RESPECTIVE PARTIES SHALL BE DETERMINED ACCORDING TO PROVISIONS OF EXISTING LAWS.

TO TABLE THE AMENDMENT TO S. 1430, WHICH PROVIDES THAT THERE BE NO CONFIRMATION OF SALES ON ENTRIES OF LANDS UPON WHICH THERE WERE BONAFIDE PRE-EMPTION OR HOMESTEAD CLAIMES ON THE FIRST DAY OF JANUARY 1888 OR ASSERTED UNDER COLOR OF U.S. LAWS; NO QUORUM VOTING.

TO TABLE S. 1430, BY WHICH POVIDES THAT THERE BE NO CONFIRMATION OF SALES ON ENTRIES OF LANDS UPON WHICH THERE WERE BONA FIDE PRE-EMPTION ON HOMESTEAD CLAIMS ON THE FIRST DAY OF JANUARY 1888, OR ASSERTED UNDER THE COLOR OF THE LAWS OF THE U.S.

TO AMEND S. 1430, BY SAVING THE RIGHT OF ANY BONA FIDE HOMESTEADER OR PRE-EMPTION CLAIMANT TO MAY 1, 1888, TO CONFIRM THE RIGHT AND TITLE OF ALL PERSONS HOLDING OR CLAIMING TITLE TO LANDS FORFEITED BY THE FIRST SECTION OF THIS ACT, PROVIDED THAT WHEN THE ORIGINAL CASH PURCHASERS ARE THE PRESENT OWNERS THEIR TITLE WILL BE CONFIRMED IF THERE HAS BEEN NO FRAUD COMMITTED.

TO AMEND S. 1430, BY PROVIDING THAT NOTHING CONTAINED IN THE ACT SHALL BE CONSTRUED TO EXCEPT FROM FORFEITURE THAT PORTION OF THE GRANT MADE BY "AN ACT APPROVED JUNE 3, 1856," CONCERNING A GRANT OF PUBLIC LANDS TO THE STATE OF MICHIGAN FOR THE MARQUETTE AND ONTONAGON RAILROAD COMPANY IN SAID STATE.
TO ADJOURN, MOTION MADE DURING DEBATE ON S. 1430.

TO AMEND S. 1430, BY PROVIDING THAT IN ALL CASES WHEN ANY LANDS FORFEITED HERETOFORE MADE TO THE STATE OF MICHIGAN, HAVE HERETOFORE BEEN DISPOSED OF BY THE U.S. UNDER COLOR OF SOME LAW OR PRACTICE CONFIRMED BY THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR WHERE THE CONSIDERATION RECEIVED THEREFORE IS STILL RETAINED BY THE GOVERNMENT, THE RIGHT AND TITLE OF ALL PERSONS HOLDING OR CLAIMING UNDER SUCH DISPOSALS SHALL BE AND IS HEREBY CONFIRMED.

TO AMEND S. 554, A BILL TO AMEND TITLE 60, CHAPTER THREE OF THE REVISED STATUTES OF THE U.S., BY ELIMINATING THE SECTION WHICH PROVIDES THAT AFTER A FOREIGN AUTHOR HAS BEEN PERMITTED TO COME TO THE U.S. AND COPYRIGHT A BOOK, NO AMERICAN SHALL THEREAFTER IMPORT AN EDITION OF THAT BOOK PRINTED ABROAD, NOT EVEN BY PAYING TARIFF DUTIES NOW IMPOSED BY ELIMINATING THIS SECTION, THE LAW STANDS AS IT IS; NO QUORUM VOTING.
TO AMEND S. 554, BY PROVIDING THAT NEWSPAPERS, MAGAZINES AND PERIODICALS SHALL NOT BE ENTITLED TO COPYRIGHT AS PROVIDED IN THE BILL.
TO PASS S. 554.
TO TABLE THE MOTION TO RECONSIDER S. 1430.
TO TABLE THE MOTION TO RECONSIDER S. 1430.

TO CONSIDER A RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT SO MUCH OF RULES 36-38, AS PROVIDE FOR EXECUTIVE SESSIONS BE SUSPENDED DURING THE CONSIDERATION OF THE FISHERIES TREATY WHEN THE SAME SHALL BE REPORTED TO THE SENATE.

TO TABLE A RESOLUTION AS AMENDED, WHICH PROVIDES THAT WHEN THE PROPOSED TREATY WITH GREAT BRITAIN SHALL BE UNDER CONSIDERATION, THE STENOGRAPHIC REPORTS SHALL BE ADMITTED AND SHALL REPORT THE DEBATES AND PROCEEDINGS WHICH MAY THEREAFTER BE MADE PUBLIC IF A MAORITY OF THE SENATE SHALL SO ORDER, EXCEPT SUCH PORTIONS THEREOF AS IT SHALL DETERMINE THAT THE PUBLIC INTEREST REQUIRES SHALL BE KEPT SECRET.  SO MUCH OF THE THIRD CLAUSE OF RULE 36 AS CONFLICTS WITH THE RESOLUTION SHALL BE SUSPENDED, IN ORDER THE SAME SHALL TAKE EFFECT; AND FURTER PROVIDES THAT DENIS F. MURPHY, OFFICAL REPORTER OF THE SENATE AND SUCH NECESSARY ASSISTANTS, WHEN SWORN, SHALL BE EXECUTIVE OFFICERS OF SENATE TO TAKE DOWN THE PROCEEDINGS AND DEBATES UPON THE FISHERIES TREATY WITH GREAT BRITAIN.
TO CONSIDER S. 2615, A BILL AUTHORIZING THE BALTIMORE AND POTOMAC RAILROAD COMPANY TO ACQUIRE AND USE REAL ESTATE FOR RAILWAY PURPOSES IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO CONSIDER H. R. 8560 (25 STAT L. 182), A BILL ESTABLISHING A DEPARTMENT OF LABOR; NO QUORUM VOTING.
TO PROCEED TO THE CONSIDERATION OF H. R. 8560, (25 STAT. L. 182), A BILL ESTABLISHING A DEPARTMENT OF LABOR.

TO DECIDE POINT OF ORDER DURING CONSIDERATION OF H.
